data.headline: S&P 500, Nasdaq, Dow, and Russell 2000 all post modest gains of 0.2–0.5% after early tech weakness reverses.
bullets: Megacap tech, chips, and software stocks recover, led by rebounds in Apple, Broadcom, and a rally in GE.
Financials and big banks provide early support to the broader market.
ZIM Integrated Shipping surges on a $4.2B buyout bid, while Paramount/Skydance and Warner Bros. Discovery advance on M&A enthusiasm.
Rivian, Norwegian Cruise Line, Wingstop, select biotechs, Ormat Technologies (on Google geothermal pact), and Palantir (on Miami HQ move) climb on stock-specific news.
Danaher drops on weak results, though its $9.9B Masimo deal lifts parts of the healthcare sector.
Oil and gold prices ease as progress in Iran–US nuclear talks reduces geopolitical risk.
No major economic data or earnings surprises, with traders awaiting key reports from PANW, CDNS, Walmart, Nvidia, Medtronic, DoorDash, Energy Transfer, and Vulcan Materials.
